reasoning: Obesity as component of metabolic syndrome is measured as prevalence, not incidence. Global obesity prevalence approximately 8-10% of adult population (8,500 per 100k). Strong geographic variation with higher prevalence in developed nations. WHO 2005 data and subsequent epidemiological surveys.
source: Kelly T et al. (2008). Global burden of obesity in 2005 and projections to 2030. Int J Obes. 32:1431-1437
